intro: Papaya nana, commonly known as the dwarf papaya, is a tropical plant belonging to the Caricaceae family. It is characterized by its compact size, typically reaching only about 1–2 meters in height. The plant produces large, lobed leaves and yellow-orange fruits that are smaller than those of the common papaya. Its flowers are unisexual, with separate male and female flowers on the same plant. The fruit is edible, with a sweet and creamy flesh, and is often used in culinary and medicinal applications.
